title: Jarmo Lehtinen
text:
Jarmo Lehtinen (born 3 January 1969) is a <a href="rally%20%28sports%29">rally</a> <a href="co-driver">co-driver</a> from <a href="Finland">Finland</a>. He was the co-driver to former <a href="World%20Rally%20Championship">World Rally Championship</a> driver <a href="Mikko%20Hirvonen">Mikko Hirvonen</a> and have scored 15 WRC wins competing under <a href="Ford%20World%20Rally%20Team">Ford World Rally Team</a> and <a href="Citro%C3%ABn%20World%20Rally%20Team">Citroën Total</a>. As of 2019, he is current co-driver for M-Sport driver Teemu Sunninen
Career.
Lehtinen started co-driving in 1988 alongside friend Jari Mikkola. He later partnered Marko Ramanen in the <a href="Finnish%20Rally%20Championship">Finnish Rally Championship</a>, and he made his WRC debut in the 1997 <a href="Rally%20Finland">Rally Finland</a>. In 1999 Lehtinen partnered Ramanen in the <a href="British%20Rally%20Championship">British Rally Championship</a> and accompanied Jouni Ampuja to sixth in Group N in the Finnish Championship. He worked with Ampuja in the Finnish Championship for another two seasons. In 2002 he took up a new role in the gravel crew for Skoda driver <a href="Toni%20Gardemeister">Toni Gardemeister</a> on the world championship. He also began to work with Hirvonen on international events. The pair have worked together on all their WRC outings since 2003, with <a href="Subaru%20World%20Rally%20Team">Subaru</a> in 2004 and with Ford since 2006, becoming runners-up in 2008. He won his first world rally at the 2006 <a href="Rally%20Australia">Rally Australia</a>. Lehtinen and Hirvonen competed for <a href="Citro%C3%ABn%20World%20Rally%20Team">Citroën</a> in <a href="2012%20World%20Rally%20Championship%20season">2012</a>.
